main event: A round, silvery-white object, the approximate size of a quarter, was observed flying over Big Spring, Texas on July 11, 1955.
interesting points: The object appeared to have streamers protruding from its rear.
The object flew on a straight and level flight path, first observed almost directly overhead and slowly faded from view.
The duration of the observation was approximately 3 minutes.
The witness was an 8-year-old boy who called his father's attention to the object.
The weather conditions were clear with light winds, which may have accounted for the sighting.
witnesses: Corporal M. B. Davis and his 8-year-old son
